intro: Malouetia mexiae, commonly known as the Mexican malouetia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
